{"step_by_step_thinking": "Odontoblasts are cells in the dental pulp that produce the dentin layer of the tooth. When a cavity is prepared, some odontoblasts may be killed. These odontoblasts are not derived from unaffected odontoblasts, histocytes, or osteoblasts. Instead, they are derived from undifferentiated cells in the dental pulp that differentiate into odontoblasts.", "answer_choice": "B. Undifferentiated cells"}
